# packages/adapter-rust/vendor/codelldb/linux-arm64/lldb/lib/python3.12/site-packages/pip/_vendor/rich/_inspect.py
@source-hash: a19246c37d5eeb87
@generated: 2026-02-09T18:00:51Z

## Primary Purpose
Rich library's object inspection module that provides detailed, formatted visualization of Python objects including their attributes, methods, documentation, and signatures.

## Key Components

### Core Class: Inspect (L23-236)
Rich renderable class for creating formatted inspection displays of Python objects.

**Constructor Parameters (L39-52):**
- `obj`: Target object to inspect
- `title`: Optional display title 
- `help`: Show full docstrings vs first paragraph only
- `methods`: Include callable attributes in display
- `docs`: Show documentation strings
- `private`: Show underscore-prefixed attributes
- `dunder`: Show double-underscore attributes  
- `sort`: Alphabetically sort attributes
- `all`: Show all attributes (enables methods/private/dunder)
- `value`: Pretty-print object value

**Key Methods:**
- `_make_title()` (L66-74): Generates default title text based on object type
- `__rich__()` (L76-82): Returns Panel-wrapped rendering for Rich console display
- `_get_signature()` (L84-121): Extracts and formats callable signatures with file links
- `_render()` (L123-214): Core rendering logic that processes attributes and generates table display
- `_get_formatted_doc()` (L216-235): Processes docstrings with cleanup and truncation

### Utility Functions

**_first_paragraph()** (L17-20): Extracts first paragraph from docstrings by splitting on double newlines.

**get_object_types_mro()** (L238-244): Returns Method Resolution Order tuple for object's class hierarchy.

**get_object_types_mro_as_strings()** (L247-257): Converts MRO to fully qualified class name strings.

**is_object_one_of_types()** (L260-270): Checks if object's class hierarchy contains any of the specified fully qualified type names.

## Dependencies
- Standard `inspect` module for introspection
- Rich components: Console, Panel, Table, Text, Pretty, ReprHighlighter
- Jupyter integration via JupyterMixin

## Architecture Patterns
- Rich renderable protocol via `__rich__()` method
- Lazy rendering through generator patterns in `_render()`
- Graceful error handling with `safe_getattr()` nested function
- Configurable filtering of attributes based on naming conventions
- File linking for callable source code navigation

## Key Features
- Syntax-highlighted object inspection
- Conditional attribute filtering (private, dunder, methods)
- Signature extraction with source file linking
- Docstring processing with control code escaping
- Pretty-printed values with length/string limits
- Sortable attribute display with callable priority
